intro: Trigonella spruneriana, commonly known as the Armenian bitter vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by pods that contain several elliptical seeds. Trigonella spruneriana is often found in open woodlands and slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
